result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey Kobus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeffrey Kobus is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeffrey Kobus was found guilty of Theft-Business Setting >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • Jeffrey Kobus was found guilty of Receiving Stolen Property >$5000 - $10,000 or Firearm [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(bm).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Jail term is with huber privileges.

Any item identifed as belonging to a third party (not the victims or the Defendant) shall be returned to that third party.
Any items clearly the property of the Defendant shall be returned to the Defendant.
All of the remaining items shall be returned to the victims and they shall have the right to retain, sell, or otherwise dispose of them as they see fit.

timeConds.notes:
Jail term is to commence immediately.
Concurrent with: to Ct. 3

1:31 pm - Defendant Jeffrey  Kobus appeared with attorney James R. Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Comments by DA. DCI Agent Loreen Glaman called and sworn. Direct by Atty. Lex. Cross by DA. Exhibit 1 marked, identified, offered and received. Cont'd cross. Redirect. James Stueber called and sworn. Direct by DA. Exhibit 2 marked, identified, offered and received. Cont'd direct. Cross by Atty. Lex. Redirect. Recross. Argument by parties. Comments and ruling by Court. Court orders restitution in the amount of $31,925.78 + 10% surcharge and items seized belonging to victims and third parties to be returned to victims and third parties. Restitution is Joint & Several.  Order to follow from DA.  Adj. 2:08 pm.
order for compassionate furlough when necessary
request for electronic monitoring
Restitution hearing on 10-28-15 at 1:30 pm

11:30 am - Defendant Jeffrey  Kobus appeared with attorney James R. Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have received and reviewed PSI. Comments by DA. Comments by Atty. Lex regarding victim statements. Statement of R.P. Statement of D.B-S. Statement of J.S. Statement of M.B-S. Statement of A.B-S. Further statement of M.B-S. DA states recommendation. Comments by Atty. Lex. Comments and ruling by Court. Restitution hearing to be held at a later date. Appeal rights given. Adj. 12:02 pm.

Ct. 1 - Sentence withheld - 5 years probation.

Conditions: 
6 month jail, with huber privileges, to commence immediately, cc to Ct. 1; court costs

11:33 am - DA calls case and states appearances. Defendant Jeffrey  Kobus appeared with attorney James R. Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge Madden and court reporter appear telephonically.  Motion stated by Atty Lex.  Comments by DA.  Further comments by Lex.  Court denies motion for adjournment for 5 months.
to adjourn sentencing
Motion hearing on 08-20-15 at 11:30 am
Sentencing hearing on 09-04-15 at 11:30 am

10:11 am - Defendant Jeffrey  Kobus appeared with attorney James R. Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA states agreement. DE pleads NO CONTEST to Cts. 1 & 3.   Court questions DE regarding the plea, plea questionnaire and elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on Cts. 1 & 3 and on motion of DA dismisses Ct. 2. Court orders PSI. Bond to continue. Adj. 10:15 am.
Plea and sentencing on 03-06-15 at 10:00 am

11:03 am - Defendant Jeffrey  Kobus appeared, in person with attorney James R. Lex by telephone.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA states motions.  Atty. Lex withdraws motion to suppress statements and does not oppose State's motion.  Court accepts withdrawal of motion and grants State's motion.  Adj. 11:05 am.

records.addlTxt: see minutes on today's date under preliminary hearing event

11:05 am - Defendant Jeffrey Kobus appeared with attorney James R. Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Special Agent, Loreen Glaman called and sworn.  Direct by DA.  Cross by Atty. Lex.  Court finds probable cause to believe felony has been committed and binds DE over for trial.  DA files information.  Parties received and reviewed and waive reading.  DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all charges.  Adj.  11:19 am.
Preliminary hearing on December 9, 2014 at 11:00 am.

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.  Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.

10:08 am - Defendant Jeffrey Kobus appeared with attorney James R Lex.  Mark T Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.
